title: Employee Transfer
description: Holly is transferred back to New Hampshire after corporate discovers that she and Michael are dating. Dwight tries to apply to Cornell to get under Andy's skin. Jim's brothers and Pam decide to play a trick on Jim when they meet for lunch.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [dressed as Carrie Bradshaw] Wow you guys look amazing. Stanley, I thought you hated Halloween.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [dressed as Raggedy Ann] Shh. He wears that so he can sleep at his desk. Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, I'm Carrie Bradshaw from Sex And The City.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mm. I like your shoes. [Kelly has 5-inch heels on]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Thank you. Will you help walk me to the fax machine?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I got her, I got her. I can help you. You look amazing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Inappropriate. Thank you. Who are you, Larry King?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Gordon Gekko.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, from the insurance commercials!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ... Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Creed dressed as the Joker enters] Whoa. Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Let's put a smile on that face!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [also dressed as the Joker] Dammit Creed! I've been up since four!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [dressed as a kitten] Meow. Sweet 'stume, dude. Who are you supposed to be?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dave.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are?  [Andy hisses] A cat?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [buzzer noise] We were looking for "kitten."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [phone] Oh, hang on one second. Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey New York, Happy Halloween!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.  My costume's getting a lot of attention. [Pam is dressed as Charlie Chaplin]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So apparently no one dresses up for Halloween here. I wish I had known that before I used greasepaint for my moustache. And I can't even take off my hat, because then I'm Hitler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [dressed as the Joker] Hm mm mm mm. Want to see a magic trick? Heh heh heh! I'm gonna make a pencil disapp- oh! [elevator doors close, reopen.] Disappear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I think we are set. We have puzzles, string for Cat's Cradles. Burned this last night. A little road trip CD. Puppets.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, look at all this stuff! It's only seven hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When Corporate found out that we were dating, they decided they were going to transfer Holly back to her old branch, in Nashua, New Hampshire.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael is taking a personal day to move me up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Road trip!  Right?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Breaker one-nine, copy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, copy that breaker. Those Duke boys are at it again.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey! Do Not Touch My Radio.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're not.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're not doing anything.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's been a weird week since we found out I had to transfer. Michael wanted me to quit and get some job here in Scranton, and I said "Well, why don't you quit and get some job in Nashua?" And he said "I asked you first."  And I said "First!" at the same time he did. And then I said "Jinx." And then we never talked about it again and haven't been back to the conversation. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right everybody. I'm out of here. Jim, you're in charge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I'll walk you out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, you are quite the gentleman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can let people go a couple of minutes early if you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right. We'll see. [to camera] No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am off to New York. My brother Pete from Boston, and my brother Tom from New Jersey are taking Pam and I out for lunch, to celebrate the engagement. Or maybe to beat me up. I can never tell with those two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good morning temp.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: 'Morning. [Dwight reveals Cornell sweatshirt] Wow. Good morning Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thought I'd go casual today. Morning everyone. Good morning.  Hello.  How are you Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha ha ha. That's funny. [angrily] Take that sweatshirt off!  Hey buddy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Remember when I jokingly yelled at you to take your sweatshirt off? Totally joking. But, you should know, those colors are sacred. Not that I care. But if you're not a Cornell man, you probably shouldn't wear them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No I get it. I totally understand. And uh, I just want to assure you, that I mean no disrespect. You see, I'm applying!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on, you think you can get into Cornell?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well if somebody who barely out-sells Phyllis, can get in, I should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm sitting right here Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I meant that as a compliment to you Phyllis, as well as a slight to Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cornell is a good school, and I want to better myself through higher education. If it makes Andy angry, so be it. [He sips from his Cornell mug]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I have to unpack this weekend but maybe next weekend we go to the outlets!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike you'll drive this every weekend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're gonna switch back and forth, the driving. Sometimes we'll just meet in the middle. It'll be fun. Wait a sec. Oh I love this song.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Holly}
quotes.text: Life is a highway, I want to ride it all night long.

quotes.speaker: {Michael}, {Holly}, and {Darryl}
quotes.text: If you're going my way, I wanna drive you all night long! If you're going my way...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey there. So uh, how do you think we're gonna do against Penn this year? Nathan Ford's arm looks pretty strong.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well he's had a pretty good season so far-- Stop saying "we." You did not go to Cornell. Okay, you're just doing this to screw with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not so. Cornell is an excellent school. Without its agricultural program, we probably wouldn't have cabbage. At least not modern cabbage.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know it's an excellent school, Dwight. I went there. My blood runs Big Red.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Someday, we'll both get together in Comstock Hall and just laugh about all of this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Hey, future baby sis!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How are you Tom. Nice to see you.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I asked Tom and Pete to come early so we could play a prank on Jim at lunch! Pretty awesome, right? I think they're into the idea. They're probably thinking, "That Pam Beasly, she's the coolest sister-in-law on the planet. She's the best! The absolute best."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, so here's what I'm thinking. I'm gonna say that before ceramics class, I took off my ring, and then when I changed back out of my smock, it wasn't in my pocket anymore, and I lost it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That's perfect. You know what would be even more hilarious? Remember that thing we did when Jim was in high school with his girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Right! That would be hilarious! We should totally dog her, about being an artist, never making any money!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That, is awesome!

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Like she basically has a hobby, for a job.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, not the ring then? The- the- Not doing the ring?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I think this is better.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: The other thing would "get" Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: This is nicer, it's fun. It's fun!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Oh, he hates it when we pick on his girlfriends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oookay....

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They came up with that idea really fast.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This trip was longer than I thought.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah it did look shorter on the map-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah! Ah! Ahhhh!  [waking up] Hey. Whew. Ow. I was having a nightmare.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You were sleeping?  You were talking before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Was I?  Really? Was I saying anything interesting?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Not really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. What's the scoop, how far?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Four hours. Almost halfway there.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We're only halfway?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Halfway! Okay, You know what I want to do, I want to pull over and find little bed and breakfast for when we meet in the middle. Emphasis on the bed. And the breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Next exit isn't for five miles.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Let's check there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi! [smooches]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Nice to see you again, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Pam, I haven't seen you in so, so long!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right so now we can sit... and get comfortable.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There's nothing out here man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I don't know I just- I imagined a hotel right here. Pool, over here. Really good breakfast place. With really good bacon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go, fourth time's a charm. "Life's like a road where you just... one day here, and the next day back...Sometimes you deal with it, today you don't, sometimes you do, what you want... there's a world out there.... [Holly sobs] Hey. Are you crying?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Allergies?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did Darryl touch you?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: WHAT!?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, Darryl did not touch me. Can we just keep going, please? [crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's the matter?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's not gonna work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure it is.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: There's too much distance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no no no.. It's gonna work, it'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael we've only been dating each other for a few weeks

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen to me. I like you so much.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: And I like you too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I've dated four women in the last-

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I've dated four guys last year too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not last - no. In like the last ten years.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've dated almost four women, and you are so far above them, it is stupid.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael. Don't. Don't. Don't make it harder than it has to be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Holly thinks that this relationship is over. Well, you know what? I am not gonna give up that easy. I'm gonna make this way harder than it needs to be.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Take that down. [Dwight has hung a large red Cornell banner from the ceiling]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Take. That down.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You know I once dated a couple of guys from Cornell. They were really nice. They gave me a ride home.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I seriously doubt that anyone from Cornell dated you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: It's pronounced Ker-nell. It's the highest rank in the military.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's pronounced "Corn-ell!" It's the highest rank in the Ivy League!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy, let's just talk about this man-to-man, after work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, good. Can we-- [Dwight pulls out Cornell mascot bobble-head] Grr. Heh heh heh. That's Big Red Bear! That's a bobble Big Red Bear! God!!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: If you leave on Friday, by five, you'll be rolling in at... midnight? At best?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: And then sleep in Saturday. That only leaves us less than 24 hours before you have to go back again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. I will talk to you on the Bluetooth the entire trip. So we're talking constantly all the way.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll tell you everything that I see. Everything that I pass by, things that I witness on the road.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe I'll see an accident one weekend?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: How long could we keep that up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Years!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Years?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Years?  Of just a few hours every weekend?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's my wish. I want you to meet a great guy, and I want you to be happy.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [kisses his temple] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My wish has come true, incidentally, because, you've met me, and you are happy.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Clever, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: So Pam, how much does an artist make after they leave art school?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, not a lot of money in the arts, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not really true. There's a lot of things you can do with an art degree actually.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Maybe Pam should pay the check by drawing a picture on this napkin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that's- that's a little rude. What's your deal?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, just having fun Jimmy.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Yeah. Right Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup! [Tom and Pete give Halpertian looks to camera]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? I think we're a great couple. I think we're a classic couple. I think we're like Romeo and Juliet. I think we... go together so well.  We're like peanut butter and jelly, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I do, I think so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Then don't do it. Please don't do this. Please don't do this. [they continue arguing]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [leaving someone a message on his cell phone, looking very uncomfortable] Hey what's up, I just thought I'd try you. I was thinking about that story where you ran into the girl you used to babysit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know what I'm gonna do!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Please call me back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You'll be okay

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not gonna be okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Please...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No I won't! I'm not strong! And I'll go back to Jan, and I hate Jan! Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [outside men's room] You might be interested- [stops when he sees Stanley come out]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy, I've been meaning to ask you, which a cappella group should I join? The Harmoniacs, or the Do-Re-Mi-Go's?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hm. Assuming you had the voice to be in any of them, it's irrelevant. Because I called admissions and it looks like I, will be conducting your university interview.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's a conflict of interest.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Big one. So, should I not let you in now, or do you want to do the interview, and then I won't let you in?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [thinks] Interview.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excellent. When the hourglass strikes three, then in the room whence employees confer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The conference room!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who are your role models?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If I had to put Dwight's chances into a percentage, I would say he has none percent chance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, Dane Cook, Jack Bauer, and Eli Whitney. You're doing great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh wow. This is my niece Vanessa. She's a trumpeter. And, look at her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That must be really fun for you and Marci huh?

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Yup. She only knows how to play "When the Saints go Marching In."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love that one.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah but, she doesn't think she's gonna be like, career musician right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here you go again! What is your deal today?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Just saying. How many famous trumpeters can you name besides... Louis Armstrong?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Miles Davis.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Chet ...something.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Half.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: The point is Pam, is there are jobs-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dizzy Gillespie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Also good.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: And there are hobbies. I love baseball more than anything, but you don't see me try to get on the Mets.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: You don't!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pete couldn't make the Mets. She's at Pratt. You played JV baseball. Will you lighten up a little bit?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I'm just calling it like I see it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know if I'm gonna make any money with art.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, don't worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean it's a very competitive field. But I have a professor who says I have a lot of promise, and if I don't try now, I never will. So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys, what is going on?!  [Pete and Tom burst out in laughter]

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: We pranked you!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: It was Pam's idea. Pam was the mastermind.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ... Got you.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That was killer. I was so close to blowing it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's see how well you know your Big Red history.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bring it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who was Cornell's eighth president?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dale Raymond Corson!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mm, I'm sorry that's incorrect. Cornell's seventh president was in fact, James A. Perkins. [writes in a notebook] Comprehension skills, sub-par.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmm, interviewing skills, sub-par. [writes in a notebook]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you writing? Can't even give Cornell your full attention?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On the contrary, I'm helping Cornell. By evaluating their interviewers.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nobody wants ...that, to happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, when they get my evaluation we'll see if they're interested.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Applicant is attempting to blackmail interviewer, showing low moral character."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Interviewer is threatening applicant with an arbitrary review process."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Applicant is wasting everyone's time with stupid and inane accusations."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Interviewer has suspect motives."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Applicant has a head shaped like a trapezoid."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Interviewer has turned off applicant's interest in Cornell, and they are going to go to the vastly superior Dartmouth." Ever heard of it? I think I have everything I need.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I have everything I need- [talking over each other]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you will be hearing from the -

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you will be hearing from -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: -Cornell Application Department,

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: which I will not be a part of-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you will not be pleased with the result. [pulls table away from Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And YOU will not be pleased with the result!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And your affiliation with Cornell -

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And your affiliation with Cornell -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Will end completely!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Will end completely!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [has won the table war] That is all sir, you may go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Michael and Holly cautiously pass each other] There's another dolly in the truck, Mike. You could take more than that lamp.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For the record, I wanted go another direction. Which was way better.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I'll be the judge of that. What do you got?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. I lost my engagement ring in ceramics class. Left it in my smock. I had this whole thing where I go back to class, wrongly accuse another girl. Look I even used makeup to put a ring around my finger, you can hardly see it, it's very subtle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Truthfully anything would have been better than that prank. [laughs] Oh, text message from my brother. "Pam cool. Welcome to the family."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Hey how about at Thanksgiving we prank Tom about being bald?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is the last of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh that's mine actually. Um, maybe put it back in the truck.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're not staying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know I have some things I need to do this weekend. I just remembered, so, I'll just ride back with you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: But you want me to put it back in the truck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll be down in just a second. [into house] Holly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So um... I think I'm gonna go back with Darryl [Holly hugs Michael] Okay. [they kiss goodbye.] Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Okay. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I know it's hard Mike. Break-ups hurt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We didn't break up.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Looked like it. Sometimes when I'm down like this, it helps to sing the blues.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [bluesy] Da na na na na...  da na na na  na...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a really pretty song.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.  No, no, check it out, look. Da  na na na na... want to do that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's when you hit me with what's getting you down, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, wait. You're, you're supposed to... Never mind. Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Da  na na na na!!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Da  na na na na .

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [deeper] Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah!  Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [deeper] Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: YEAH! Da  na na na na.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [blues singer] Da  na na na na...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Whistling, enters office in farmer overalls]  I thought I'd come in casual today. Man, I'm hungry. Anyone else feel like a beet?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where did you get those?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What, these?  Bernard Farms. Best beets in the state.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I see what you are doing. But I do not know where you are going with this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well you will. Soon as you visit, my new beet farm. [attempts to bite into a raw beet, beet is too hard] You're supposed to cook these, aren't you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Cornell. [easily bites into a beet]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We'll miss you.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Well, I'll be around.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [chuckling] Isn't it a seven-hour drive?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: It's not that bad. But if I'm really jonesing to see you guys, I can always fly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know if it'll be shorter to fly. [Holly gasps] You have to drive to Boston, right? That's an hour and a half. Get there an hour before the flight. Now you're up two and a half hours. The flight to Philadelphia is an hour fifteen. It's another two and a half hour drive to Scranton, assuming there's no traffic, because....

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [interrupting Oscar] Well, I just want to say goodbye. [hugs Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, Hol, this is it.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah, okay. [extends hand to Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [outstretches arms for a hug, Holly reluctantly complies]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [whispers in Holly's ear, Holly reacts with horrified look]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [pushing Kevin away] Um, yeah, that's not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, but you have to admit it would be wild.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, you're dumping Michael? Smart.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, we're gonna do the long-distance thing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh! You guys are gonna keep dating? That's so romantic!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I almost quit my job so I could be closer to Bob, and we're in the same building.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, well....look, we could always call, or email, or write. I should get all your email addresses.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, we'll email you, and then you'll have our addresses.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [talking head] It's a little sad. Michael and I just started dating. He wants me to stay and get a job around here as a baker. Or a baker's helper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [talking head] This is gonna be awesome. This is gonna be awesome. I've decided that on my drives to Nashua, I am going to learn French, the language of love. And on my drives back, I am going to learn Spanish; what the cleaning crew speaks.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [talking head] I'm driving them up for five times what I would've made at work. I thought I made a good deal. [expression changes from smiling to downcast] Then I realized I'm gonna be trapped in a truck with Mike all day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [playing cat's cradle with Holly] Okay, am I grabbing this one?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [chuckling] No, that's not what you're grabbing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Put....okay....

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [driving truck] Hey, y'all are not gonna be playing these little private games all the way.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Sorry, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's like Driving Miss Daisy, you know?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You gotta include me in the conversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fair enough.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If you don't mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. What kind of car games did you play in the 'hood?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I got a game. Cow surfing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cow surfing?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Spot a cow, last person to say "Jackson Five" has to get on its back and ride it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Were there even cows where you grew up?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Everybody got a government cow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cow surfing. [spots a cow out the window] Okay, here we go, there's a cow.

quotes.speaker: {Holly} & {Darryl}
quotes.text: [in unison] Jackson Five!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, shoot! Okay. All right. All right. [throws up hands] Pull it over. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Here we go. Go get him, Mike!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reaching to open door] I'm gonna do it.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [grabs Michael's arm] No, Michael. It's not a real game.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Then why did you say "Jackson Five?"

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The man has a point.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Darryl....

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, I made it up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [visibly shocked] What? Why?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Because I wanted you to like me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gasps] I do! Hey, come on!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [trying not to laugh] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jackson Five.

quotes.speaker: {Holly} & {Michael}
quotes.text: [both laugh hysterically at portable DVD player on dashboard while Darryl drives, looking miserable]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [makes sudden sharp turn to the left, causing DVD player to fall out open window, then grins to camera]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [rubbing noses with Holly] You're the one.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you are.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You are more.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [rubs face in exasperation]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're the best.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You're better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're better. You're better than my best.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: You're better than betterest.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [plants kisses all over Michael's face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Hold your breath!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Ready?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [setting stopwatch] Go.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} & {Holly}
quotes.text: [both inhale deeply and lock lips while holding their breath]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [looks to camera for several seconds] At least it's quiet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch this. Darryl, watch this.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Look, Darryl, lip up.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} & {Holly}
quotes.text: [kiss each other while puffing their cheeks and mumbling]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Down, and give me 50!

quotes.speaker: {Michael} & {Holly}
quotes.text: [in unison while kissing with mouths closed] One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, you know what would be fun? Like, sleeping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You know.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [hugging Michael] Oh, snuggles!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Right, snuggle time.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Snuggles.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [makes squeaking sounds]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Spooning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's what I was thinking. The following weekend, I drive up.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We get right in the car, we pop up to Montreal. It's like another seven hours.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ooh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Speak.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We could stay in a cozy B&B with a fireplace?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely. Oh, and you know what, Darryl? You are invited to go as well.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. Thanks. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, it'll be fun.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [emerging from convenience store with two ice cream sundaes] Hey, look at that. Fun, right?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm mmm! Remember the 15-scooper we had last week? Wasn't that good? I was Scooperman, you were Scoopy-Doo. Remember what you said? You were laughing.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Say what you said.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No, Michael. I don't....[mimicking Scooby-Doo] I'm gonna puke!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] I'll save you! I'm Superman! Scooperman!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Darryl didn't want any?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't ask.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We want the same things.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I know, but from seven hours away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a lucky number. Seven. 7-Up. Seven dwarfs.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael....

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Seven deadly sins. It's a sign.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, y'all wanna hear some loud music or something?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I'm an atheist. Did you know that? I don't know your religion. There are so many conversations that we haven't even had yet.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, look, Pennsylvania license plate! That's crazy! All the way out here! Who can name all the states?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing with Holly next to "Welcome to New Hampshire" sign] Oh, it's really cold here.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, it's just later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [holding camera] Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [starts to cry] Can we have another? I think I blinked.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [unlocking front door] This is me here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you have your own entrance. That's nice.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Stairs. Oh, man....

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He's just trying to push your buttons.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't care, so it doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Great, then it doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You don't think he could get in, though....right? I mean, I don't care, but I just don't see how he could. I doubt he could get in.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [reverently] He is fiercely intelligent.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't care either way, so....shut up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He's just....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in parking lot on cell phone] Don't tell me to calm down, Dad! [grunts] Don't do that! Oh, God, of all people, I thought you would understand. You're an alum. This guy, he's....he's poking the bear! [listens briefly] Yeah, okay, I'll see you at Thanksgiving. Hi to Mom. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why are you doing this to Andy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You once told me that Andy and I had different strengths. Well, he can't do what I can do. I can get into Cornell, but he doesn't know how to make food and shelter from a golden retriever.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [looks at Dwight disgustedly and sighs] Even if you do somehow get in, that's not going to make me leave Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, but it'll make you respect him less.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sighs] Yes, that's true.
